Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

DD_Attribute_Full.name: msl:solution_id
DD_Attribute_Full.definition:
The MSL:SOLUTION_ID element specifies the unique identifier for the solution set to which the values in the group belong.
For certain kinds of information (such as pointing correction and rover localization), more than one valid set of values may exist simultaneously. Each of these sets is called a 'solution' to the unknown actual value. The SOLUTION_ID is used to identify which solution is being expressed by the containing group.
It is recommended that projects adopt a specific naming convention for MSL:SOLUTION_ID. The convention will assist the user in identifying a specific instance of values used. Components making up the naming convention for SOLUTION_ID include one or more or the following: date/time, group id, institution, program, purpose, request ID, user, and version. New components may be added as needed.
NOTES: The value of SOLUTION_ID must not be reused for new solutions - it must be globally unique.
A single solution can cross many data sets (e.g. for a mosaic). Therefore, you may see an SOLUTION_ID with the same value appearing in many different data sets.
When in a COORDINATE_SYSTEM_STATE group, this keyword identifies the solution ID of the coordinate system being defined by that group.
The special name 'telemetry' is used for values telemetered from the rover.

Terminological_Entry.name: msl:solution_id
Terminological_Entry.definition:
The MSL:SOLUTION_ID element specifies the unique identifier for the solution set to which the values in the group belong.
